response.answer_text: I will tell you a simple way to figure out which number is greater. You have to make the given decimal number into whole number by multiplying and dividing with multiple of 10. Then we can compare the whole number which is greater and which is less. In above question the numbers are 0.2 & 0.05 First multiply and divide with 100 to make numerator part free from decimal point. Next, since the denominator part is equal, compare the numerator. 0.2 * 100 / 100 =0.05 * 100 / 100 20 / 100 = 5 / 100 Compare numerator 20 is greater than 5 Therefore 0.2 is greater than 0.05. Thanks to A&A. If you learnt something new then upvote this answer.

Yes. To know this, you should give the decimals the same amount of numbers after the decimal point. To make this the case, make 0.2 become 0.20. Don't worry, they have exactly the same value. This is one of the reasons why decimals are so different to integers, decimal numbers can have 2 million digits after the decimal point, but it could be smaller than a decimal number with 1 digit after the decimal point. ANYWAY, now 0.2 and 0.05 will be easier to compare. 20 is bigger than 5 so here you go…. 0.2’s value is bigger than 0.05’s.

The two simple methods to guess the answer are, First:- Consider You wana check if LHS > RHS or not. Put 0.2 on LHS nand 0.05 on RHS. Now multiply 100 on both the sides. Since we are doing multiplication on both the side, it's fine to do so. 0.2*100 =20=LHS 0.05*100 = 5=RHS So this shows LHS is greater than RHS. It means 0.2 is greater than 0.05. Second:- We can easily do this by using number line.  You can see number in the photo. The more you move on thr RHS side, greater the number will become. The more you move on the LSH side, smaller the number become. So 0.2 comes after the 0.05 on the RHS side. This also proves that 0.2 is greater than 0.05. Thanks!

Shortest Answer: Yes Decimals are organized into tenths, hundredths, thousandths, ten thousandths and so on Or another form .1 = 1/10 .01 = 1/100 .001 = 1/1,000 This also means that a decimal like .21 is equal to 21/100 This is why 0’s that come after the decimal point don’t matter 1.1 = 1.10 1 + 1/10 = 1 + 10/100 This means: .2 = .20 .05 = .05 .20 ? .05 Since they both now have the same number of decimal numbers, we can look at them as if they have zero decimals: 20 ? 5 And as 20 is greater than 5 20 > 5 .20 > .05

Yeah 0.2 is greater than 0.05.If you wandering how,i will make you clear. You can omit the decimel in both number by putting the digits below them .Here it becomes 02/10 and 005/100 Now you can self evaluate it If we divide 2 into 10 parts and divide 5 into 100 parts Which will be greater? Oviously 2/10 So in this way 0.2 is greater than 0.05. Hope you understand!

Yes, because 0.2=2/10 which is great than 0.05=5/100. It means we have done 10 pieces of 2apple and 100 pieces of 5 apples. Now I think one can understand that it means in 1st case we get 5 pieces from one Apple whereas in 2nd case we get 20 pieces of a Apple. Now, just think that the Apple which has been cut into 5 pieces has a greater piece than the Apple which has been cut into 20 pieces. Therefore, 0.2 is greater than 0.05 Thanks.

Yes, 0.2 is greater than 0.05. This can be easily proved by multiplying both the numbers by 100. 0.2 X 100 = 20 0.05 X 100 = 5 Now, you can easily check which one is greater. 20 is greater than 5, and hence, 0.2 > 0.05.

If both are positive then, Yes ofcaurse 0.2 is greater than 0.05 because we compare the digit by digit after decimal (point) so , here 2>0 there fore o.2 is greater than 0.05 or you can compare both numbers by multiplying 100 to both numbers 0.2*100 = 20 and 0.05*100=5 you can replace 100 by 10 or 1000 or any number but multiply both value by same number.
yes. 0.2 is equal to 0.20 try adding 0.2 to 0.05, which will give 0.25 do (0.2/0.25) x 100 which equals to 80% then do (0.05/0.25) x 100 which equals to 20% 80% is more than 20% :)

Yes, since 0.2 is 2÷10 and 0.05 is 5÷100 If we use an analogy 2 medium-size pizzas are divided by 10 people and 5 pizzas (same size) are divided by 100 people then we know that size of divided pizza of the first division should be greater than the second one. I hope it helps.

They like to put these kind of questions on late-elementary school tests because the kids see 2 and 5 and will answer that 0.05 is greater than 0.2, which is wrong. Therefore, 0.2 is 4 times larger than 0.05, because if we think 0.05 as 5, and 0.2 as 20, (Since we multiplied by the same value, 100.) we can now easily see that 0.2 is larger than 0.05.

Yes, 0.2 is greater that 0.05 Suppose a scale is having a reading from 0–1 Divide that section into 10 equal parts, you'll be getting 0.1, 0.2,…,0.9, and finally 1 Now, if we further make 10 equal sub sections of these parts we'll get 0.01, 0.02, 0.03,.., 0.05,…, and finally 0.1 So here we can see that 0.2 is much greater that 0.05
The closer the number is to the comma(when it is behind that is) the bigger value it has. So if you multiply 0.2 by 10 you get 2 but if you multiply 0.05 by 10 you get 0.5. So 0.2 is bigger the 0.05

Yes. O.2 is simply out of ten decimal places. once you get to 0.10 it is just one, because if there are is no 0, it’s out of 10. 0.05, however, is out of 10, rather than 10. So if 0.2 is twenty, 0.05 isn’t 50, it’s five.

0.2 is greater than 0.05.its because 0.2 = 2/10 or, 1/5 or, 4/20 & 0.05 means 5/100 or, 1/20. Fraction 4/20 indicates 4 out of 20 i.e, if you have twenty chocolates then you have to consider four out of twenty(i.e, 4/20 = 2/10 = 0.2). and 1/20 indicates you have to consider one out of twenty(i.e, 1/20 = 5/100 = 0.05).

Yes 0.2 is two tenths in fractin form while 0.05 is five hundredths in fraction form. Very confusing indeed since hundredths seems larger than tenths although 2 is closer to 10 than 5 is to 100. 2 is 8 away and 5 is 95 away.

Yes 0.2 is greater than 0.05 We can write 0.2 as 2/10 and 0.05 as 5/100 Now when we take the same LCM we get 4/20 And 1/20 Again multiply both of them with 20 , We will get 4 and 1 respectively. Which proves 0.2 is greater than 0.05
